timeline.bodyText:
Based on the link from your spec issue (https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus/wiki/Default-port-allocations), it sounds like we should update that wiki page and reserve a default value dedicated to OpenTelemetry.
If we aren't ready to do that yet, I'd suggest we make port a required configuration.
timeline.author: trask
trask

replies.bodyText:
I have switch to this API, however I still don't get any metrics from my APP.
An alternative solution might be to implement adapter for MetricProducer in PrometheusMetricExporterFactory that would cache the metrics returned by the MetricExporter.
replies.author: pavolloffay

replies.bodyText:
There is smth weird going on, I am not able to get metrics from the app to the agent.
In the debugger I see the metrics being collected (OpenTelemetrySdk.getMeterProvider().getMetricProducer().collectAllMetrics()) but the exporter or collector do not get any metrcics.
replies.author: pavolloffay

replies.bodyText: It seems that the app is using a different instance of OpenTelemetrySdk.getMeterProvider  than the agent.
replies.author: pavolloffay

replies.bodyText: My issue is that the opentelemetry-api-beta does no kick so the calls to the OTel API in the app are noop. Since I have included only the API.
replies.author: pavolloffay

replies.bodyText:
Finally, I have managed to get this working. There are two things that I have learned by hard:

the app should use only the OTel API
I had to rebase and use OTEL 0.9.0-SNAPSHOT API in the app.
replies.author: pavolloffay

replies.bodyText:
sorry about that ☹️
I logged #1279 for the first item, and bumped priority for the second item #1043, though that issue will magically go away once we GA since we will support all GA OTel API versions
replies.author: trask

timeline.bodyText: @trask @anuraaga why there is versions.opentelemetryOther and version.opentelemetry?

replies.bodyText: Jfrog has been well behaved recently but often some of the snapshot artifacts have different version suffixes. We've found there to be cases of three different suffixes for the same version. An annoyance when dealing with snapshots that will go away with GA so currently living with it.
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText:
Which one should I use?
Currently all point to the same versions
    opentelemetry       : '0.9.0-20200925.025016-49',
    opentelemetryOther  : '0.9.0-20200925.025016-49',
    opentelemetryAnother: '0.9.0-20200925.025016-49',

timeline.bodyText: Why is this Collector and not Exporter?

@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@ +/* + * Copyright The OpenTelemetry Authors + * + * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); + * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. + * You may obtain a copy of the License at + * + * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 + * + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software + * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, + * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. + * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and + * limitations under the License. + */ + +package io.opentelemetry.javaagent.spi.exporter; + +import io.opentelemetry.sdk.metrics.export.MetricProducer; + +/** + * A {@link MetricCollector} acts as the bootstrap for metric exporters that use {@link + * MetricProducer} to consume the metrics. + * + *

Implementation of {@link MetricCollector} must be registered through the Java SPI framework. + */ +public interface MetricCollector {

replies.bodyText:
The name was suggested by @trask. I think we can do better.
I am more in favor of removing this interface and use #1273
replies.author: pavolloffay

replies.bodyText: You mean removing all individual SPIs and having one single SPI OpenTelemetrySdkCustomizer?
replies.author: iNikem
pavolloffay

replies.bodyText:
@iNikem MetricExporter is for push-based metric exporters, there isn't a corresponding SDK interface for pull-based exporters
the name MetricCollector makes sense to me because they call collectAllMetrics() on the MetricProducer, as opposed to customizing the MetricProducer
but I'm also good with MetricProducerCustomizer
I think the important thing that we should only support one of these two configurations:

A single MetricProducerCustomizer + zero MetricExporterFactory, or
Zero MetricProducerCustomizer + any number of MetricExporterFactory (whose exporters we wrap in a single IntervalMetricReader)

(but this doesn't need to be in this PR, I created #1281 to track this)
replies.author: trask

timeline.bodyText:
I think this method requires documentation to explain what is going on here. Just by reading it I don't understand what is a connection between PrometheusCollector that we built and registered and HTTPServer that we started later. How that server gets metrics?
The absence of javadoc on PrometheusCollector does not help it neither :)
timeline.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: +1 I will add some docs.
replies.author: pavolloffay

timeline.message:
Add prometheus exporter

Signed-off-by: Pavol Loffay <ploffay@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText: Instead of this undocumented naming convention what do you think about adding a String getExporterName() method to the MetricProducerCustomizer interface?
timeline.author: mateuszrzeszutek

replies.bodyText:
ya, this has come up for SpanExporterFactory and MetricExporterFactory also #1253 (comment) 😄
I will create a tracking issue for this
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText: I think we have two different issues here. One is how to select this or that exporter. Two, it is not obvious that the class name of MetricProducerCustomizer should start with the same string as MetricExporter. E.g. if we make MetricProducerCustomizer.getExporterName it will be confusing to me: "why customizer of MetricProducers is connected to an exporter"?
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: @iNikem the metrics can use the pull and push model. The p8s metric exporter uses pull model. It pulls metrics from OTEL once the metric endpoint is hit.
replies.author: pavolloffay

replies.bodyText: But push model is supported by our Exporters API, they don't need any new SPI, right?
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: @iNikem MetricExporter supports push model, but not pull model. Pull model has to use MetricProducer directly, e.g. https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/blob/a08dd9fbe4a98f34aec3618475905fa55fece87e/examples/prometheus/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/example/PrometheusExample.java#L46-L48
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText:
E.g. if we make MetricProducerCustomizer.getExporterName it will be confusing to me: "why customizer of MetricProducers is connected to an exporter"?

This is maybe a reason to rename MetricProducerCustomizer. The question is what to rename it to?
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText:
Some options:

MetricConsumer
MetricCollector
MetricEndpoint
replies.author: trask
pavolloffay

replies.bodyText: there's some benefit to having different factories for push and pull cases, since we can support multiple push factories, but only a single pull factory (and not both): #1281 (comment)
replies.author: trask
trask

timeline.bodyText: Just wondering: shouldn't these settings be prefixed with otel.exporter. or at least otel.?

replies.bodyText: oh ya, this just changed in #1254, ExporterConfig used to automagically add the prefix

Implementation of {@link MetricServer} must be registered through the Java SPI framework. + */ +public interface MetricServer { + + /** + * Initialize the metric server that pull metric from the {@link MetricProducer}. + * + * @param producer The metric producer + * @param config The configuration + */ + void configure(MetricProducer producer, Properties config);
